newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dollar ends firmly after slow grind higher.
newsitem.headline: NZ dollar ends firmly after slow grind higher.

text.p: A stronger Australian dollar and a weak U.S. dollar made for a firmer Kiwi by Monday's close. Dealers said the Kiwi may grind higher overnight.
The currency had traded a 0.6817-32 range on the day, before ending at US$0.6926/33, assisted by buying interest from Asia.
The Trade-Weighted Index ended at 68.70, down from 68.85, largely reflecting the U.S. dollar's demise against the mark and the yen.
"That certainly helped Kiwi become well-supported, together with the Aussie recovering," he said.
By 0500 GMT the Australian dollar was at US$0.7753/58, having hit an overnight low of 0.7725.
"It (Kiwi) is not really breaking any new ground but it does look as though we will probably head a touch higher," said one Wellington dealer.
Another dealer said there was a little corporate activity towards the end of the session but that trade had been very thin. The expected overnight range was 0.6815-40.
